text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Angolan Interior Minister Andre Pitra said in a meeting with his Congolese counterpart he was concened about the influx of refugees and soldiers of the former Mobutu regime coming into Angola from the former Zaire. Pitra also expressed concern with a buildup of military elements on the northern border of the Cabinda enclave, which borders Congo.
- U.S. congressmen Donald Payne and Tom Campbell met Angolan President Jose Eduardo dos Santos on Monday about the situation in the Democratic Republic of Congo, formerly Zaire.
